definition: to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Now I am making an attempt to explain the positions of categories such as primitive accumulation and some others.
sentences.chinese: 這裏，對原始積累等範疇的位置，試提出一種解釋。

sentences.english: Gathering frequent flyer miles is one of the perks of OCS travel.
sentences.chinese: 積累飛行里程是商務旅行的額外補貼之一。

sentences.english: Compared with the TFP, the role of labor capital accumulation are more prominent.
sentences.chinese: 與TFP相比而言，勞均資本積累的作用更爲突出。

sentences.english: When a dam is built, the accumulating water presses down upon the rock below.
sentences.chinese: 當大壩建成，逐漸積累的水壓壓向下方的岩石。

sentences.english: Mannitol accumulates more than other little molecular carbohydrates in A. mellea.
sentences.chinese: 甘露醇是蜜環菌體內積累較多的小分子糖類成分。

sentences.english: Yes. You can't learn these words from textbooks; you just get them from daily life.
sentences.chinese: 對，這些詞課本上是學不到的，都得在生活中積累。

sentences.english: And the business department of China's largest non-Ping'an small accumulation of land.
sentences.chinese: 與中國最大的非營業部，平安的小塊土地的積累。

sentences.english: Treat it gently by allowing your equity to grow steadily rather than in bursts.
sentences.chinese: 與其暴贏，不如緩進，穩紮穩打地積累資產。

sentences.english: Jason: No, I just want to accumulate some useful experience there.
sentences.chinese: 傑森:不想，我只想在那裏積累一些有用的經驗。

sentences.english: Books are the ever-burning lamps of accumulated wisdom the world of eternal.
sentences.chinese: 書籍是積累世人智慧的不滅的明燈。

sentences.english: According to the rumor, Sun Yue will be transfered to the low level league NBDL for the more experiences.
sentences.chinese: 據傳孫悅會被下放到低一級別的NBDL去積累經驗。

sentences.english: Moreover, it will help accumu-late funds for China's great cause.
sentences.chinese: 還會有助於爲中國的偉大事業積累資金。

sentences.english: It is caused when water gets accumulated in the ear canal and leads to an infection.
sentences.chinese: 這是造成水時會積累的耳道，並導致感染。

sentences.english: Separate holding tanks can be installed to accumulate this slurry prior to dewatering.
sentences.chinese: 可以安裝分開的接受器在脫水之前積累這泥漿。

sentences.english: It's a building-block process much like a math course.
sentences.chinese: 這就像數學課一樣，是一個需要積累的過程。

sentences.english: The drug suramin, which is used to kill invading trypanosomes, is accumulated in lysosomes .
sentences.chinese: 用來殺死侵入的錐蟲的藥物蘇拉明，在溶酶體中積累。

definition: practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
